roleset.name: to declare or make legally valid
roleset.note: VALIDATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'validate' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from validate.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: validate-v: transitive
example.text: [He]-1 reaped inflation along with rapid growth , no doubt [*-1]validating Sir Alan 's predictions in the Prime Minister 's mind .

example.name: validation-n
example.text: My talks gave validation to those who believed they were learning about many aspects of life, including spirituality, from their pets.
example.arg: to those who believed they were learning about many aspects of life, including spirituality, from their pets

roleset.name: grounded in truth/legality
roleset.note: VALID-J NOTES: Updated by Julia based on BOLT-1. Related to 'validate-v.01'. (from valid.01-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: This key is valid for entry.

example.name: both args
example.text: My travel authorization is valid for travel to the United States but will expire before I depart.
example.arg: for travel to the United States
